resurface verb
(APPEAR AGAIN)
[ I ] to rise to the surface of the water again: When the divers did not resurface after an hour, three crew members dived down to look for them.
[ I ] to appear again after being lost, stolen, or absent: Please contact me if any of the stolen paintings resurface. Jill resurfaced last week, after spending the past few months doing research in the library.
[ I ] If a memory resurfaces, you remember it again after you had forgotten about it: Memories of his childhood resurfaced when he saw the photographs.
